results.title: Wag the dog
results.creator_credit: Barry Levinson, Jane Rosenthal, Robert De Niro and New Line Cinema
results.brief_description: Two weeks prior to re-election, the President of the United States becomes involved in a sex scandal concerning a Girl Scout in the Oval Office. To keep the media from learning of this, Presidential adviser, Winifred Ames, brings in political consultant and spin doctor, Conrad Brean, a specialist in salvage operations. They both join forces with Hollywood producer, Stanley Moss, and in an attempt to divert the country’s attention away from the President, they redirect the media spotlight to a war. Lacking a real war, they create one. Cast includes: Dustin Hoffman, Robert De Niro, Anne Heche, Woody Harrelson, Denis Leary and Willie Nelson.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Barry Levinson, Jane Rosenthal, Robert De Niro and New Line Cinema

results.title: The Milky way = La Voie lactee
results.creator_credit: Luis Bunuel, Serge Silberman, Fraia Film and Greenwich Film Production
results.brief_description: Pierre and Jean journey to a holy shrine in Northern Spain (Santiago de Compostella). Are they pilgrims or tramps? No one knows their identity or their true motives. During the course of their pilgrimage, their faith is severely tested by some of the irreverent characters. Even chance meetings with Jesus Christ, the Virgin Mary and the Devil are not quite what Pierre and Jean have been prepared for through their religious training. This late Bunuel film is one of his most direct treatment of the Catholic Church and the six central mysteries of Catholic dogma: the nature of God, Christ, the Virgin Mary, the Eucharist, divine grace and evil. In French with English subtitles.

results.title: The Kill-off
results.creator_credit: Maggie Greenwald, Lydia Dean Pilcher and Filmworld International Productions
results.brief_description: Set in a bleak north-east American beach town, this nihilistic drama circulates around Luane, the bedridden town gossip, who manipulates members of the down-and-out community with her vicious rumour-mongering. Her machinations drive her victims to increasingly desperate acts that cumulate in a final showdown. While the world Greenwald reveals is relentlessly bleak, her portrayal of human sleaze and savagery is achieved by subtle means. She injects Thompson’s novel with a wry black humour and a hint of the surreal.

results.title: The Shining
results.creator_credit: Stanley Kubrick and Producer Circle Company
results.brief_description: In Stanley Kubrick’s chilling adaptation of a Stephen King horror novel, Jack Torrance, a struggling writer, accepts a job as caretaker of the Overlook Hotel, a luxurious but remote resort with a macabre history of violence. The hotel is closed for the winter, and Jack, his wife, Wendy, and son, Danny, will be the only residents for several snowy months. Jack hopes that the solitude will give him a chance to focus on his writing, but he soon spirals helplessly towards madness and murder as the hotel’s power plays upon his weaknesses. Cast includes: Jack Nicholson, Shelley Duvall, Scatman Crothers and Danny Lloyd.

results.title: Chinese roulette = Chinesisches roulette
results.creator_credit: Rainer Werner Fassbinder, Les Films du Losange and Albatros
results.brief_description: An intense, psychological comedy/drama about a disabled girl, Angela (Andrea Schober), who plots to get herself, both her parents (Alexander Allerson and Margit Cristensen), and their respective lovers (Anna Karina and Ulli Lommel) to the family’s country house all at the same time. The scene is set for a weekend of intense embarassments and confrontations, climaxing in the game of psychological warfare, Chinese Roulette. Typically Fassbinder, the film is a biting attack on the institution of marriage and on middle-class morality. In German with English subtitles.

results.title: Lost honour of Katharina Blum = Die verlorene Ehre der Katharina Blum
results.creator_credit: Volker Schlondorff, Margarethe Von Trotta, Willi Benninger, WDR, Paramount Pictures, Orion Pictures Corporation, Cinema International Corp and Bioskop Film
results.brief_description: Katharina Blum (Angela Winkler) spends the night with Ludwig Goetten (Jurgen Prochnow), a new acquaintance who is, unknown to her, under police surveillance. This one night stand has serious repercussions for Katharina who is brought in for police questioning. Her basic civil rights ignored at every turn, Katharina is relentlessly grilled about her relationship with her one-night stand. As a result she loses her job, her friends, and her standing in the community. Unsatisfied with this, the police go after Katharina’s family. Her story is also exploited by the ‘yellow press’, which hounds her and depicts her as everything from loose woman to communist moll. And so, through the mirror of a manipulative press, Katharina becomes the most hated woman in Germany. The film achieves a compelling portrait of Germany in the mid-seventies (the lead years), during which the fight against the Red Army Faction led a number of State agencies to use any means possible to fight terrorism, while a manipulative right wing press sent an entire country in a frenzy over the breakdown of law and order. This originally made for TV production is adapted from the novel by Heinrich Boll (itself based on actual events). In German with English subtitles.

results.title: Fists in the pocket = I pugni in tasca
results.creator_credit: Marco Bellocchio, Enzo Doria and Doria Film
results.brief_description: This bizarre drama chronicles the strange activities of a blind widow living with her four children - Augusto, Sandro, Leone and Giulia. The burden of supporting the family falls on Augusto, the only one of the four not afflicted with epilepsy. When Sandro determines to help Augusto break away and marry his girlfriend, he can see only one way to do it; and sets out to kill the rest of his family. Accompanied by a powerful film score by Ennio Morricone. In Italian with English subtitles.

results.title: The Threepenny opera = L'opera de quat' sous. Die Dreigroschenoper
results.creator_credit: G Pabst, Seymour Nebenzal, Warner Brothers First National Productions, Nero-Film and Tobis Filmkunst
results.brief_description: In 19th Century London, Mack the Knife, a small-time criminal, marries Polly, the daughter of beggar-king, Peachum, and finds himself in a lot of trouble. In the early years of the sound era, film producers often made films in different language versions, using the same sets but different casts for each version. Pabst followed this practice with his twin versions of ‘The Threepenny Opera’ in German and French- ‘Die Driegroschenoper’(98 min.) and ‘L’Opera de Quat’ Sous’(105 min.). The two versions offer rich material for comparison. The German version was originally released in 1931 amidst political and legal controversy. The Nazis, rankled by its socialist message and attacks on government authority, ordered the destruction of the original negative and every print that could be found. The film’s unavailability bolstered its legendary status and, after many years of searching, a complete negative was found and a restored version released in 1960. Music by Kurt Weill. From the play by Bertolt Brecht and Kurt Weill. In French and German with English subtitles.
results.title_for_label: The Threepenny opera = L’opera de quat’ sous. Die Dreigroschenoper

results.title: Scream 2
results.creator_credit: Wes Craven, Marianne Maddalena, Cathy Konrad and Miramax Films
results.brief_description: The first ‘Scream’ (308434) was a clever genre deconstruction of the do’s and dont’s of the teen slasher film, so it’s not so surprising then that ‘Scream 2’ pays clever homage to sequels. Like all good horror sequels the body count is higher, the murders are more gruesome, but contrary to the belief held by the film literate teens in this film that “sequels suck”, ‘Scream 2’ pleasingly holds its own. It even has it’s own film within a film, “Stab”, the movie version of the events of the first film. This time round, Sydney Prescott (Neve Campbell reprising her role) is at college trying to put the Woodsboro murders behind her, that is until a series of campus murders aping the killings of the first film make it clear that someone is planning a sequel of their own. Director Wes Craven, (no slouch to the genre himself having made ‘Nightmare on Elm St’ and ‘The Hills have Eyes’) and writer Kevin Williamson inject fresh ‘blood’ into the formula by presenting a group of characters to care for (not just a bunch of disposable, horny teens), and by not sacrificing the frights for the sake of a cheap laugh, a common malady of contemporary horror. Cast includes David Arquette, Courtney Cox, Sarah Michelle Gellar, Heather Graham, Jamie Kennedy, Laurie Metcalf, Jerry O’Connell, Liev Schreiber and Jada Pinkett.

results.title: Street of shame = Akasen chitai [NTSC]
results.creator_credit: Kenji Mizoguchi, Masaichi Nagata, Daiei Motion Picture Company and Janus Films
results.brief_description: The setting is a Tokyo brothel, ironically called Dreamland. The content is the thoughts, disappointments and aspirations of the occupants. This was Mizoguchi’s final film, and one in which he returned to his earlier theme of the exploitation of women throughout the ages. He does so by integrating the stories of five prostitutes which covers the roles of women as daughters, mothers and wives. Many believe that this film was pivotal in the 1957 decision to abolish prostitution in Japan. Cast includes Daisuke Kato, Machiko Kyo and Aiko Mimasu.
